attributes.action: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to to introduce free & plentiful two wheel vehicle parking in all congestion chargeable zones.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The lack of available parking for two wheel transport is a blatant statement by central government & their councils that there is no genuine interest in any congestion reducing or green environment schemes.



This is a ‘green’ petition to introduce free & plentiful two wheel vehicle parking in all congestion chargeable zones.


THIS PETITION SHOULD NOT BE ABOUT A PERSONAL DESIRE TO GET PARKING AVAILABLE FOR AN INDIVIDUAL (however, such a scheme would be most logical and humanitarian). THIS PETITION IS ABOUT CREATING A FUNDAMENTAL GROUNDWORK INITIATIVE TO REDUCE CONGESTION AND PROPERLY ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES.



London’s public transport system is currently dangerously over subscribed without sight of future solutions. This petition requests the sensible encouragement of alternative 'greener' forms of transport such as two wheel vehicles should be encouraged.

Currently there is little incentive to encourage commuters to travel into London on two wheels. Parking is too expensive to justify the additional road accident risk.

Two wheel vehicles include motorbikes & bicycles.

rejection.details: The responsibility for managing traffic and parking in urban areas rests with local, not central, government.  The legislation empowering local authorities to impose parking and congestion charges deliberately leaves considerable discretion for local authorities to design schemes that are appropriate for local conditions. See e-petition response: http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page16628
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
